xxl.core.math.statistics.nonparametric.kernels
Interface KernelFunctionND

All Known Implementing Classes:
ProductKernelFunction, ProductKernelFunction.Biweight, ProductKernelFunction.Epanechnikow
public interface KernelFunctionND

Classes implementing this interface provide a n-dimensional kernel function evaluating objects of type double [] representing a n-dimensional real-valued vector. A kernel function of dimension n is defined as
f : R^n --> R with x |--> f(x).
There are two common ways to implement kernel functions of higher dimensions. In the first one a product kernel function is easily obtained by combining n one-dimensional kernel functions. The second one directly realizes a spherical kernel function.

See Also:
KernelFunction, ProductKernelFunction

Method Summary
 double eval(double[] x)
          Evaluates the kernel function at given real-valued n-dimensional point x given as an object of type double [].
 

Method Detail

eval

double eval(double[] x)
Evaluates the kernel function at given real-valued n-dimensional point x given as an object of type double [].

Parameters:
x - function argument given as double []
Returns:
f(x) with f : R^n --> R
